data.description:
Think of Iggy as “Wordpress for Web3 Social”. A web3 framework that lets you easily set up a Web3 Social app for your community.

**Open Source and Free**

Iggy is completely free to use! The code is open source and available on GitHub:

- Frontend code: https://github.com/iggy-social/iggy-social-frontend 
- Smart contracts: https://github.com/iggy-social/iggy-contracts 

The Iggy framework includes many useful plugins that go beyond just a social app, such as a token swap module, NFT launchpad module, Send Tokens module, etc. 

These modules are all optional and developers can decide on their own which ones to use (or even develop new ones). 

**Where is it used**

Some of the communities that use the Iggy framework are the PoolTogether DAO, Scrolly web3 community, Degen token community, Based Nouns community, Flare community, Mode Network community, BasePunk NFT community, Taiko community, etc.

Here are a few of them:

- ModeChat: https://modechat.xyz/ 
- Scrolly Hub: https://hub.scrolly.xyz/ 
- BasePunk community: https://chat.basepunk.xyz/ 

**Impact**

The impact of Iggy as a low-code web3 framework is to save developers a ton of time launching a Web3 Social site for any DAO or web3 community. 

From our experience so far, developers are loving this tool, and we expect the usage of Iggy to grow much more in the near future.

**Next steps**

The next steps are the launch of the Iggy Admin dashboard, which will help communities easily manage their smart contracts.

After that, we plan to launch a tool that will help developers easily deploy new Iggy-based smart contracts.

Last but not least, we will prepare a tutorial that will show developers how to launch an Iggy-based Web3 Social site and how to use plugins/modules that are part of the Iggy framework.

**Links**

- Project Twitter Account: https://twitter.com/IggySocial 
- Your GitHub Username: https://github.com/tempe-techie 
- GitHub Organization: https://github.com/iggy-social
data.title: Iggy - Web3 Social Framework

data.description:
Iggy framework has a swap module, where users can swap tokens. If a user is referred to the site by another user, then the referrer's address is included in the swap, so that they can receive a referrer's fee.

There is an issue with using swaps when referrer address is present. The purpose of this milestone is to find the issue and fix it.
data.title: Fix the swap issue when referrer is added

data.reason: The bug has been finally found and fixed in this commit: https://github.com/iggy-social/iggy-social-frontend/commit/35c2146fb6b0839a6ac0709aff6f56d0f17aed43
The bug has been finally found and fixed in this commit: https://github.com/iggy-social/iggy-social-frontend/commit/35c2146fb6b0839a6ac0709aff6f56d0f17aed43

data.description: Add support for audio (music) and video NFTs in the NFT Launchpad section. In case an NFT has video or audio in its metadata, show it to NFT holders.
data.title: Add support for audio and video NFTs

data.reason:
This update implements support for audio and video NFTs. It creates a media section where rich media formats are shown (audio file, video file or YouTube video). The Media section is visible only to NFT holders, just like the chat section.

The milestone is completed with this commit: https://github.com/iggy-social/iggy-social-frontend/commit/e6866cc68d6d42810fb71a0adafcfbd0d34a1e4f

This update implements support for audio and video NFTs. It creates a media section where rich media formats are shown (audio file, video file or YouTube video). The Media section is visible only to NFT holders, just like the chat section.

The milestone is completed with this commit: https://github.com/iggy-social/iggy-social-frontend/commit/e6866cc68d6d42810fb71a0adafcfbd0d34a1e4f

data.description:
A feature in the NFT Launchpad section of Iggy Social where users can send their minted NFT to another address or domain name.

The feature should enable users to easily find their NFT token IDs, and also load the NFT image in case the NFT collection has different images for each token ID.
data.title: Transfer/send NFT to another address or domain name

data.description:
Loading IPFS files (e.g. images) can be tricky. Sometimes a file is accessible via some gateway, but not via another gateway.

Relying on only one gateway is not sufficient. A better strategy is to have a system which tries to load an IPFS CID via multiple gateways (one-by-one). If one gateway cannot find the file, it tries another (a timeout for each call needs to be implemented, too).

As soon as the working URL is found, it should stop trying out gateways.
data.title: Improved loading of IPFS files (images etc.)

data.reason:
A few new functions were added to ipfsUtils in the Iggy Social framework. These functions help Iggy find an IPFS file by trying out multiple IPFS gateways (one-by-one).

The commit that implemented this milestone update is here: https://github.com/iggy-social/iggy-social-frontend/commit/808a46805a16bb5f8f6ca0f11ba13c805a62cf74

A few new functions were added to ipfsUtils in the Iggy Social framework. These functions help Iggy find an IPFS file by trying out multiple IPFS gateways (one-by-one).

The commit that implemented this milestone update is here: https://github.com/iggy-social/iggy-social-frontend/commit/808a46805a16bb5f8f6ca0f11ba13c805a62cf74

data.description: Public RPC providers can be unreliable sometimes, so implement a way to have multiple providers and pick them on random to load data when user is not connected with their wallet.
data.title: Improve the way of getting an RPC provider in the Iggy web3 template

data.reason: Improved RPC loading implemented in this commit: https://github.com/iggy-social/iggy-social-frontend/commit/e74a62171ba7e61dd9f99b2ad4bbd787f74704f8
Improved RPC loading implemented in this commit: https://github.com/iggy-social/iggy-social-frontend/commit/e74a62171ba7e61dd9f99b2ad4bbd787f74704f8

data.description:
- Iggy framework has a plugin that allows users to launch their own ERC-721 NFTs.
- These NFTs have some extra (non-standard) functions, e.g. a built-in liquidity pool.
- When user visits an NFT details page on Iggy for an NFT that was launched via Iggy Launchpad plugin, the NFT details (name, image, description etc.) will be presented properly. The URL of this details page contains the address of the NFT, for example: `https://demo.iggy.social/nft/collection?id=0x82F6291A6c12467886e428C95D7b98C586E905B1`
- But if user instead enters an address of an NFT that was not created via Iggy Launchpad, the NFT details (name, image etc.) will not load.
- For this milestone the task is to enable NFT details to be loaded also for NFTs that were not launched via Iggy Launchpad.
data.title: NFT details: Show also NFT that is not created via the NFT Launchpad plugin

Thank you! Milestone accepted, Zer8

data.description: Implement an Image component, which will handle the loading of IPFS better than the tag. The main issue with IPFS images is that they are sometimes not accessible through some IPFS gateways. By default, Iggy uses Cloudflare IPFS gateway, but sometimes this gateway does not find an IPFS image, which results in a broken image link, even though the image is on IPFS. The solution is to create an Image component, which has a fallback mechanism to handle this problem. So in case image is not accessible via Cloudflare gateway, it would try to fetch it through another gateway.
data.title: Implement Image component with a fallback mechanism

data.description:
- Iggy framework has a plugin that allows users to upload images to IPFS via Spheron.
- Spheron is shutting down its IPFS service.
- Rewrite the plugin code to transition from Spheron to ThirdWeb for image uploads to IPFS.
data.title: Transition from Spheron to ThirdWeb for image uploads

data.reason: Transition from Spheron to ThirdWeb has been completed in this commit: https://github.com/iggy-social/iggy-social-frontend/commit/5b3beb10062f2284e70ddbe286c5e0ae4217edbb
Transition from Spheron to ThirdWeb has been completed in this commit: https://github.com/iggy-social/iggy-social-frontend/commit/5b3beb10062f2284e70ddbe286c5e0ae4217edbb

data.text: Polygon has recently shut down the Mumbai testnet.  Iggy was by default set to the Mumbai testnet, so we had to transition to the new testnet. We chose Sepolia.
data.title: Transition from Mumbai testnet to Sepolia testnet

data.title: GG22 OSS - Developer Tooling and Libraries

questions.query: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
questions.explanation: We participated in the GG20 OSS Program (Developer Tooling and Libraries). Our profile is here: https://explorer.gitcoin.co/#/projects/0xbe25f387e9a599ccf2cb0525a5e69be8704ac8e610fe7b26f32023c390fcc5c4

questions.query: Provide a brief overview of your tool, library, or framework. What specific problem or inefficiency in the development process does it address?
questions.explanation:
Iggy is an open-source framework that makes it easy to create Web3 Social apps, like how Wordpress helps build websites. 

It solves the problem of building social dApps from scratch by offering ready-made modules, like chat, token swaps, and NFT launchpads, that developers can add or change as needed. 

This saves a lot of time when setting up Web3 Social sites, and many DAOs and web3 communities are already using it.

questions.query: How does your project reduce development barriers, improve efficiency, or enhance the security of Web3 projects? Please provide specific examples or metrics if available.
questions.explanation:
The Iggy framework is low-code, open-source, and completely free to use, helping developers save time and enabling web3 communities to easily launch their own social dApps.

Some of the communities that use the Iggy framework are the Scrolly web3 community, Degen token community, Flare community, Mode Network community, BasePunk NFT community, etc. 

Here are a few examples:

- SGB Chat (web3 community chat): https://sgb.chat/ 
- NFT Degen (social NFT launchpad): https://nftdegen.lol/ 
- Scrolly (web3 hub): https://scrollyfi.xyz/ 
- Degen Radio (social music playlists): https://degenradio.lol/

questions.query: Describe the current usage and support for your tool within the developer community. This could include GitHub stars, downloads, or testimonials from developers.
questions.explanation:
Iggy has been used in 10 different dApps so far:

- SGB Chat: https://sgb.chat/
- FLR Chat: https://flr.chat/
- Modechat: https://modechat.xyz/
- NFTdegen: https://nftdegen.lol/
- Scrolly Hub: https://scrollyfi.xyz/ 
- Always Liquid: https://alwaysliquid.com/
- BasePunk NFT community: https://chat.basepunk.xyz/
- MeowNFTs: https://meownfts.com/
- Satraps Forum: https://forum.satraps.io/
- Degen Radio: https://degenradio.lol/

questions.query: Outline your project's roadmap and how the grant funds will be used to achieve your development goals.
questions.explanation: Our roadmap focuses on developing new features based on user requests and helping communities set up their own Web3 Social dApps using the Iggy framework. We allocate funds to support our growth, allowing us to stay independent without relying on VC funding.

questions.query: For any project deploying smart contracts on blockchain networks, please list all your deployer addresses and their corresponding blockchain networks. Use this format for each entry: [deployer_address], [chain_id]—for example, 0x123abc..., 42161 (This represents a deployer address on the Arbitrum network). Please include a separate line for each unique deployer address and blockchain combination.
